Quaternary red earth sediments are widespread in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River in southern China, and these deposits have experienced intense syndepositional pedogenesis under humid tropical to subtropical conditions
1, 2 . Like the loess-paleosol sediments of northern China, the red earth sediments in southern China are also records of climatic and environmental changes during the period of their formation
